bibl.title: Letter from H. C. Woodfall to Henry Rose Carter, November 9, 1921

div1.p: Woodfall informs Carter that all papers dealing with malaria have been sent to LePrince.

div1.head: Letter from H. C. Woodfall to Henry Rose Carter, November 9, 1921
div1.opener:
STATE OF GEORGIA
1776
I.W.
T. F. ABERCROMBIE, M. D.,
SECRETARY AND COMMISSIONER
OF HEALTH
H. C. WOODFALL, DIRECTOR,
DIVISION OF SANITARY ENGI-
NEERING AND WATER ANALYSIS
STATE BOARD OF HEALTH
DIVISION OF SANITARY ENGINEERING
ATLANTA
Nov. 9, 1921.
Asst. Sur. General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter,-
div1.p:
As requested in your letter of Oct.
29, I have this day sent to Mr. LePrince at Memphis
all papers on malaria which you have sent to me at
different periods.

I had a copy of all these papers
made for my files, and at the same time had an ex-
tra copy made, which I am enclosing, as I thought
very probably you would like to have a set of these
papers at Washington.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, H. C. Woodfall, Director. HCW:MFS.
Encl.
